episodes.title: DOJ UNDER FIRE: Epstein Survivors Slam DOJ for "Betrayal" as Powerful Names Stay Redacted in Files
episodes.description:
In a landmark bipartisan show of force, Jeffrey Epstein survivors joined members of Congress at the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday to demand an immediate investigation into the Department of Justice's "betrayal" of victims following the botched release of the Epstein files. Standing alongside lawmakers including Rep. Pramila Jayapal and Rep. Nancy Mace, survivors condemned the DOJ for leaking their personal information and nude images while redacting the names of powerful co-conspirators. The press conference preceded a high-stakes House Judiciary Committee hearing where Attorney General Pam Bondi faced intense questioning over the department's failure to release over 3 million remaining documents. Lawmakers and advocates simultaneously unveiled "Virginia’s Law," a historic legislative push to eliminate the statute of limitations for sexual abuse, ensuring that the wealth and influence of global elites—including princes, ambassadors, and prime ministers—can no longer provide immunity from prosecution.
